member.name: M:Google.Api.Ads.Common.Lib.AdsSoapClient.GetDefaultNamespace
member.summary: Gets the default XML namespace, based on the type of this object.
member.returns: The XML namespace to which this object is serialized, or an empty string if the method fails to retrieve the default namespace.
member.remarks: All the services making use of the XML Serialization framework (including ones generated by wsdl.exe and xsd.exe) will have a WebServiceBindingAttribute decoration, something like: [System.Web.Services.WebServiceBindingAttribute( Name = "SomeServiceSoapBinding", Namespace = "https://the_xml_namespace_for_serializing")] public partial class SomeService : SoapHttpClientProtocol { ... } The only exception to this rule is when we choose to write our own serialization framework, by implementing IXmlSerializable on AdsSoapClient. If and when someone does that, and someone were to call this method, then he/she will get an empty string from this method.

member.name: T:Google.Api.Ads.Common.Util.SerializationUtilities
member.summary: This class provides utility methods in serializing and deserializing an object as xml.

member.name: F:Google.Api.Ads.Common.Util.SerializationUtilities.customSerializerMaps
member.summary: A map to store custom xml serializers.
member.remarks: For background, see http://support.microsoft.com/kb/886385/en-us. The summary of the issue is that .NET runtime will leak XmlSerializer objects if the non-custom constructor (custom rootNode, namespace, etc.) is requested, and hence the serializers need to be cached locally. To replicate memory leaks, write AdWords API code that will throw a lot of SOAPExceptions. The XmlSerializers obtained for deserializing the SOAP exceptions will be leaked by the runtime.

member.name: M:Google.Api.Ads.Common.Util.SerializationUtilities.LoadXml(System.String)
member.summary: A mono-friendly version of XmlDocument::LoadXml.
member.param: The xml string to be loaded into DOM.
member.returns: The xml as XmlDocument.

member.summary: Deserialize an object from xml for a custom root node and xml namespace.
member.param: The xml namespace of the object in serialized xml.
The root node name for the object in serialized xml.
member.returns: The deserialized object or null if deserialization fails.
member.remarks: must be XmlSerializable.

member.param: The xml namespace of the object in serialized xml.
The root node name for the object in serialized xml.
member.returns: The xml serializer.
member.remarks: See http://support.microsoft.com/kb/886385/en-us and http://code.google.com/p/google-api-adwords-dotnet/issues/detail?id=78 for more details.
